TITLE: 'Cancel it all or do nothing': Readers react to the chance of $10,000 in student loan forgiveness
SUMMARY: CNBC.com asked readers how they'd feel about the White House forgiving $10,000 in student debt. Dozens of people wrote in. Here's what four of them had to say.

TITLE: That socially responsible fund may not be as ‘green’ as you think. Here's how to pick one
SUMMARY: That impact fund may not be as ‘green’ as you think. There are some simple steps investors can take to make sure their fund aligns with their values.

TITLE: There's a push in Congress for a new national retirement plan to fill big savings gap
SUMMARY: A bipartisan group of lawmakers is looking at a proposal to help the millions of workers without access to a workplace retirement plan.

TITLE: Here are key steps women can take to close the retirement savings gap
SUMMARY: Women are paid 83 cents for every dollar men earn. That can make it more difficult for them to set aside meaningful retirement savings.

TITLE: House Democrats push Treasury, IRS for repeal of rule blocking state and local taxes cap workaround
SUMMARY: Three House Democrats are pushing for relief on the $10,000 limit on the federal deduction for state and local taxes by pleading to reverse a 2019 rule.

TITLE: Health insurers poised to pay $1 billion in rebates to 8.2 million people this year
SUMMARY: If you have an individual health insurance policy — i.e., through a state exchange — or are in a small- or large-group plan, you’re more likely to get a rebate.

TITLE: Nearly half of families with kids can no longer afford enough food 5 months after child tax credit ended
SUMMARY: Nearly half of parents who got expanded child tax credit checks now say they can't afford enough food to feed their families, according to a May survey.

TITLE: Ready to buy muni bonds again? Consider this hidden tax before piling in
SUMMARY: If you're buying municipal bonds, the interest may trigger higher Medicare premiums. Here's what to know before piling in.

TITLE: More wealthy Americans are living paycheck to paycheck after inflation surge
SUMMARY: Even wealthier Americans are feeling financially strained as the prices for goods keep climbing.

TITLE: 'Buy now, pay later' loans make it tough to get a handle on your credit
SUMMARY: The popularity of "buy now pay later" soared during the pandemic. Now some consumers are realizing this type of credit could be a risky way to take on debt.

TITLE: Social Security’s funds have a new, later-projected depletion date of 2035. How Congress may shore up the program
SUMMARY: Congress is on the hook to make sure Social Security can pay benefits in full and on time. Here's what changes legislators may consider.

TITLE: The IRS is working to increase its audit rates for higher earners
SUMMARY: The IRS is working to increase its audit rates for the wealthiest Americans, according to a statement released by the agency.

TITLE: Is now the time to start a side hustle? Here’s what to know
SUMMARY: "If you don't have the money and you know that, you've got to find something else you can do," said Suze Orman.

TITLE: Suze Orman: Inflation is here to stay for quite some time. This is what you should buy
SUMMARY: Personal finance expert Suze Orman believes this is the "number one investment" to combat inflation.

TITLE: How to pay for college after a financial setback
SUMMARY: If you just experienced a financial setback, you may still be able to get more college aid for next year. Here's what you need to know.

TITLE: Op-ed: Financial literacy should be a family affair to help empower future generations
SUMMARY: It's key that parents start the "money conversation" with their kids. Here’s a basic guide of financial concepts that you can discuss with kids at various ages.

TITLE: Consumers spend an average $133 more each month on subscriptions than they realize, study shows
SUMMARY: Many subscription services allow for automatic payment of monthly fees by debit or credit card, making it likely many users may forget about the ongoing costs.

TITLE: Biden administration will cancel student debt for half a million students from Corinthian Colleges
SUMMARY: Around 560,000 student loan borrowers who attended Corinthian Colleges will soon get their balances cleared, senior Biden administration officials say.

TITLE: Investors revisit muni bonds amid higher yields and strong credit
SUMMARY: It's been a tough year for muni bonds with investors cashing out amid rising interest rates. But higher yields and strong credit may be sparking a shift.

TITLE: The job market is still hot — for now
SUMMARY: Layoffs are at record lows while job openings and the number of voluntary departures are near all-time highs. But the good times for workers may not last.

TITLE: 54% of teenagers feel unprepared to finance their futures, survey shows
SUMMARY: Some 54% of teens are worried about affording higher education, according to a survey from Junior Achievement USA and Citizens Bank

TITLE: Need to tap your 529 college savings plan soon? Here's how to handle a stock market downturn
SUMMARY: Months of stock market volatility may deliver smaller-than-expected 529 college savings plan balances, which may be a burden for parents this summer.

TITLE: Advice for the class of 2022: What new graduates need to know about money and jobs
SUMMARY: Transitioning from school to the adult world of work and money isn't necessarily easy.

TITLE: This advisor started a financial non-profit to empower women. Here’s her top investing and entrepreneurship advice
SUMMARY: Stacy Francis founded Savvy Ladies, a non-profit providing free financial advice for women, after seeing her grandmother suffer from spousal abuse.

TITLE: These bachelor's degrees from public colleges pay more than $100,000
SUMMARY: It's more important than ever for students to find colleges and programs that offer the best value. These degrees from public universities top the list.

TITLE: 25% of Americans are delaying retirement due to inflation, survey finds
SUMMARY: Due to high inflation, one-quarter of Americans will have to delay their retirement, according to the BMO Real Financial Progress Index.

TITLE: A pay freeze vs. returning to the office: Workers equally hate both options
SUMMARY: Workers dislike the idea of returning to work in person full time, suggesting the staying power of the pandemic-era arrangement.

TITLE: Feeling behind on retirement savings? These tips can help you make up for lost time
SUMMARY: Saving for retirement may seem like a daunting goal. But moves you make to save more now can help you live more comfortably later on.

TITLE: Medicare Part B premium reduction won’t happen this year
SUMMARY: Medicare officials have determined that a mid-year change is not feasible, despite significant cost savings related to coverage of Alzheimer's drug Aduhelm.

TITLE: Rising gas prices and inflation top travel concerns, overtaking Covid, survey finds
SUMMARY: Most Americans plan to travel this summer, but rising gas prices and inflation now top their list of concerns, overtaking Covid.
